skill.name: github-pr-best-practices
skill.description: Best practices for creating GitHub pull requests including conventional commits, PR formatting, and multi-language support (en/ja). Use when creating PRs, writing PR descriptions, or formatting commit messages.

skill.author: 1natsu172

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reads. This skill provides guidance templates and best practices for creating GitHub pull requests.

content.value_statement: Creating pull requests without clear standards leads to confusing reviews and delayed merges. This skill provides proven templates and guidelines for writing PR titles, descriptions, and formats following conventional commit standards. Supports both English and Japanese output.
actual_capabilities: Generate conventional commit formatted PR titles
Structure PR descriptions with proper sections
Support English and Japanese PR content
Avoid common PR mistakes with checklists
limitations: Does not execute git commands automatically
Does not interact with GitHub API directly
Requires manual review before final submission

use_cases.title: Standardize PR format
use_cases.description: Apply consistent PR titles and descriptions across your team with conventional commit standards

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Guide contributors to write clear PR descriptions that speed up review time

use_cases.title: Create bilingual PRs
use_cases.description: Generate PR content in English or Japanese to support multilingual development teams

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request for a new feature that adds OAuth2 authentication with the following commits: 'feat(auth): add OAuth2 login' and 'feat(config): add provider settings'. Use English output.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a PR description for fixing a race condition in session management. The root cause was concurrent requests modifying session state. Use Japanese output.

prompt_templates.title: Complex change PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR description for migrating API from v1 to v2. Include breaking changes about response format and user ID type changes. Follow the complex change template.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation update
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for updating API documentation. The changes include new endpoints, authentication examples, and fixed parameter descriptions. Use the documentation template.

output_examples.input: Create a PR for adding user profile features with avatar upload and bio editing
output: - Implement avatar upload with image processing
- Add bio and social links editing
- [ ] Test bio editing with various markdown
- [ ] Test file size and format validation

best_practices: Follow conventional commit format with type, optional scope, and clear description
Keep PR summaries to 1-3 bullet points explaining what and why, not how
Always include a test plan with specific, actionable checkbox items
anti_patterns: Using emojis in PR titles or descriptions breaks professional standards
Vague descriptions like 'Updated stuff' provide no context for reviewers
Creating PRs without analyzing all commits misses important changes

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any LLM that can read markdown documentation.

faq.question: What conventional commit types are supported?
faq.answer: Supports feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, and revert types.

faq.question: How do I switch between English and Japanese?
faq.answer: Specify the language in your prompt. Default is English. Use 'Use Japanese output' for Japanese content.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a read-only documentation skill. It does not access files, networks, or external services.

faq.question: Why are my PRs rejected by CI?
faq.answer: Ensure title follows format 'type(scope): description' with no emojis and proper tense. Check project-specific templates.

faq.question: How is this different from git-analysis skill?
faq.answer: Git-analysis gathers commit information. This skill formats PR content. Use them together for best results.
